snippet: Yang Jinjun is the first among 100 people accused of corruption and pursued abroad by Beijing this year to be returned.
abstract: China's Central Commission for Discipline Inspection announces businessman Yang Jinjun, who is accused of corruption and has been living in United States for 14 years, has returned to China; says forced repatriation was accomplished with cooperation from US authorities; Yang is first of 100 people pursued by Chinese authorities abroad to be sent back home.
lead_paragraph: Yang Jinjun is the first among 100 people accused of corruption and pursued abroad by Beijing this year to be returned.

headline.main: U.S. Repatriates Fugitive Businessman Long Sought by China
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sends a Suspect in Graft Case Back to China
